intro: Neomammillaria standleyi, commonly known as the Standley's milk barrel cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, spineless cactus with a globular shape and a greenish-gray color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It has a shallow root system and is adapted to arid environments. Neomammillaria standleyi is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive appearance.
